Since its first year, ArtContact Istanbul has been continuing tirelessly, taking into account

the universal language of art, its unifying and developing power, despite the adversities

experienced in the world and in our country.

ArtContact Istanbul International Contemporary Art Fair strives to become an international

platform where local governments, non-governmental organizations, art education

institutions and educators come together by highlighting the Art In The Public Space as well

as the Gallery, Artist, Collector trio.

We give importance to the strengthening of art markets, the development of youth, the

strengthening of international artistic relations and the realization of new projects. We want

ArtContact Istanbul to be a fair that creates and froths relations.

ArtContact Istanbul is hosting more than 1500 artists from 42 countries under the umbrella

of more than 100 participants this year. During the fair, which will be held in an area of

ten thousand square meters, more than 40 talks, workshops, live performances and B2B

meetings will be held.

ArtContact Istanbul 2023 âInstitution Honor Awardâ is given to the Art Association for

Goodness, âHonorary Award for Contribution to Artâ is given to YahÅi Baraz, âArtist Honor

Awardâ is given to BUBI.

We would like to thank all the organizations that supported our fair, our participants, artists

and visitors, and hope an enjoyable fair you to visit.

Hope to meet you at ArtContact Istanbul 4th International Contemporary Art Fair between

22-26 May 2024.

Whenever I think about the painting of Bubi. I

remember the saying of Beus: âFrames Have shown

up and paintings disappear.â For Bubi, a painting

should not be an object of view; It should not be sold

or make you think about hanging it on a wall. That

is because it is a personal a effort of an artist and

his personal way of living. Nothing else should step

between it.

All paintings we have ever known failed to go beyond

being an invention of the consumption society. This

applies to all movements, old or new. From this point

of view, we inevitably draw the conclusion that Bubi

is looking for a non-existent painting. There is only

one way to achieve this: to throw up on all the

paintings we know. This attitude is easily revealed in

Bubiâs paintings. It is cearly seen.

Bubi does not want the public to enjoy or cheer

up with his paintings unlike Matisse. He asks them not to look at the paintings and to

put tem on the ground. He wants them to bump the paintings into a wall, demolish them

and feel the Joy of destruction and disintegration. Bubiâs painting is a protest from the very

beginning. What is more protest is almost a principle for him. It is way of living; that is

why his paintings.

Do not offer happiness or joy. Except for some of his initial paintings and his plays with a

paper his stitches on the paper and his diving into the collages his paintings do not smile:

they sulk. They rather make you feel anxious. Briefly they revolt at the consumer society.That

is because the society allows him to be an individual.

Because of this Bubi will Start not the see the canvas and to deny it. Now paintings should

be completed with cloths and glue.In tihs way, painting is not only overflow the canvas and

becomes a part of the craft but also it has become an occupation that requires collective

workmenship.

Cloths, yarns and ropes have replaced the artistâs brush.

Bubi almost formed a grudge against âportrayingâ. He goes as far as kicking the painting.

He does so by marking protest day by . Burning the bridges he passes on by on and

surrounding himself with the âcagesâ and looking at the world from there.

But how long ?

All the way, Of course.

Art for Goodness Association was founded by a beautiful coincidence on 15 April 2016,

the birthday of Leonardo da Vinci, in order to bring art to wider audiences and to carry out

projects that embrace all segments of society. Although our period and working style are

different, our motivation is similar to that of the Medici Family, who lived in Italy between

the 14th and 17th centuries and has been remembered for their support for art. We can

say that this motivation has increased since the day we were founded, with the projects we

support the production of young artists in order to understand, recognize and contribute to

the spread of art in Turkey. So what are we doing to support the dissemination of Turkish

contemporary art and artists? We visit artistsâ workshops every Tuesday, and with these

visits, we have the opportunity to get to know the artists living in Turkey closely, experience

the works they produce in their workshops and establish bonds with them. In our Tuesday

meetings, we sometimes organize exhibition tours accompanied by our art consultant, we

gain more command of terminology with our consultantâs explanation, we get one step

closer to art every time and we follow the art agenda closely.

On the way we started with the philosophy of Art for Goodness, we have signed many

projects and exhibitions in order to contribute to the production of young artists. We as

Art for Goodness Association implemented One Year in the Passage project under the

direction of Prof. Dr. Nedret Sekban and artist AslÄ± Ãzok to support the artists who have just

graduated from Mimar Sinan Fine Arts Faculty Painting Department and need a workshop

to produce., we brought 264 paintings to Turkish Contemporary Art, with the motivation to

cover the production costs of young artists graduated from Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University

Fine Arts Faculty Painting Department for a year and to create a workshop environment for

young artists. We have helped artists gain new experiences with our trips abroad. In the

project, which has completed its 4th year this year, we aim to include all the graduates of

the faculties of fine arts in Turkey.

Then, we realized the Impressions from Anatolia project, which we carried out to introduce

students studying at faculties of fine arts in Anatolia to the contemporary art scene in Istanbul.

Impressions from Anatolia is a project where the Art for Goodness Association hosts successful

students who continue their education in fine arts faculties in various cities of Anatolia in

Istanbul, introduce them to the art environment and contribute to their development. In the

context of the project, which aims to support the education of young artists, a piece of work

produced by the students within two months after their visit to Ä°stanbul finds the opportunity

to meet art lovers in the context of the Impressions from Anatolia exhibition, which bears the

same name as the project. With this project, our association hosted 97 students from the

Painting Department of the Faculty of Fine Arts of 36 provinces in Anatolia to visit important

art venues and events in Istanbul, and brought them together with the art environment. Our

project continues its activities in its 3rd period.

We believe that art should be accessible and therefore its visibility should increase even

more. For this, we think that it should not be limited to galleries and museums, and that

it would be appropriate to use areas that have opened their spaces to art and made

it suitable for it. On this occasion, we collaborated with Ege YapÄ±, Turkeyâs real estate

brand that adds value to art, and realized the AtÃ¶lye Cer project with the participation of

professional artists. The space allocated by Ege YapÄ± under the name AtÃ¶lye Cer for the

distinguished artists to come together and produce works of art in the Cer Istanbul project,

meets the workshop needs of the artists for production and provides a completely modern

and free working space. The project hosts the activities of 17 young and talented artists,

offering a working space for them for 2 years. The artists involved in the AtÃ¶lye Cer project

had the opportunity to organize both group and solo exhibitions in a special exhibition

space established in Cer Istanbul.

Then, we implemented the Alenen Sanat project in cooperation with Akasya Culture and

Art. It is aimed to discover and promote the new generation of artists within the scope of

the Alenen Sanat project. Alenen Sanat, a multidisciplinary art project in which various

fields from painting to sculpture, from digital arts to installation are evaluated together, is

realized with the participation of many valuable young artists. In the project, which plays

an important role in the development of artists, the works of talents who want to develop

their art careers are brought together with art lovers.

We provided the opportunity to bring the works produced in our four projects to art lovers

by taking part in many international contemporary art fairs and exhibitions. Within the

scope of the activities of the association, many exhibitions have been attended, including

406 Art Meetings, dozens of exhibitions, national fairs such as Contemporary Istanbul

Contemporary Art Fair, Artweeks Akaretler and Art Contact, international fairs such as Art

Basel, Art Miami, Venice Biennale, and London Frieze. In addition, we created a value

of over 70 million liras for the art economy, including the art purchases of the members

of the association, the contributions of its corporate supporters, the workshop production

areas they created, the events they organized, the exhibitions, the fairs and art events they

participated in, and the media reflections in return for the promotional activities.

As Art for Goodness Association, we received approval to participate in the grant support

program we applied for within the scope of the project encouraging the participation of

young women artists in the development of local cultural policy as a result of our meetings

with the Consulate General of Sweden in Istanbul. With this project, we were entitled

to receive approximately 600 thousand liras grant support from the Consulate General

of Sweden in Istanbul. We think that the place and importance of women in the art

world is very great. Therefore, we applied to this program with a project that will bring

women artists to the fore. We included the provinces of Van, Erzurum, DiyarbakÄ±r, Mardin,

Mersin, NevÅehir and Sivas in order to encourage the participation of young women

artists in the Development of Local Cultural Policies with the Art Ambassadors project we

developed. We aimed to encourage the participation of young women artists in these

provinces in the formation of local cultural policies and to strengthen their infrastructure

with research and training to be organized on this subject. Young artists selected from the

provinces determined within the scope of the project received Trainer Training from experts

in Ä°stanbul. Afterwards, they return to the provinces they came from under the supervision

of our association and continue to contribute to the development of the art environment as

a kind of art ambassador in the light of the trainings they received in local governments,

institutions and universities.

The Art for Goodness Association, making efforts to provide a sustainable art environment

and to spread artistic teachings among the broad masses of the public, has recently

implemented the AtÃ¶lye ArnavutkÃ¶y project, with the support of the Istanbul Metropolitan

Municipality (Ä°BB). Atelier ArnavutkÃ¶y project was designed to meet the space needs of

artists from different disciplines. In the Atelier ArnavutkÃ¶y project, which is planned to

increase the production of art, with the support of the Istanbul Metropolitan Municipality,

we will offer the opportunity of workshop and exhibition space to artists who need space

for production. At the new art center of Istanbul, where 15 artists will start activities at the

beginning, applications will be collected with an open call by our association to the art

community, and after the evaluation of the selection committee, more artists will be allowed

to participate in the AtÃ¶lye ArnavutkÃ¶y program in the near future. At AtÃ¶lye ArnavutkÃ¶y,

which will also be open to interaction with the people of the region, workshops will also

Art for Goodness Association has implemented the first and longest-lasting art education

program in Turkey, in collaboration with Artkolik, at BahÃ§eÅehir University. BahÃ§eÅehir

University, BAU MBA Certificate Program offers a rich content to the participants by

addressing all layers of art and culture disciplines. The 4th module of the BAU MBA

Certificate program, which is in 3 terms this year, was completed in April.

We decided to develop a project on the occasion of young artists who needed support after

the earthquake that took place in KahramanmaraÅ on February 6 and caused destruction

in 11 cities. We implemented the Women and Child Friendly Space project, which covers

areas where women who take on many responsibilities including child, patient and elderly

care in the tent cities established in the region can socialize, participate in art activities

together, where children can receive education and engage in art activities. The needs

of women and children in the region will be tried to be met with the Women and Child

Friendly Space project, which was initiated under the consultancy of Prof. Dr. RahÅan DÃ¼ren

and Sociologist and Trainer AslÄ± SaÄal. The first stop of our project was the Blue Tent City

in Hatay where 1200 people live with the support of Mersin Metropolitan Municipality.

Finally, we launched the Arts for Goodness Childrenâs Academy. Our aim is to bring

children together with art, to popularize and adopt art at a young age and to allow this

age group to discover themselves. At the same time, it not only supports the art production of

child artists, but also helps to increase their visibility. At the Childrenâs Academy, exhibition

tours are organized in areas dominated by contemporary art and orientalism, such as Pera

Museum, SakÄ±p SabancÄ± Museum, and Arter. At the same time, childrenâs workshops, iPad

drawing workshops and theater training has been planned.

The Art for Goodness Association, which supports the art education of young people

with the projects it has developed together with the Fine Arts faculties throughout Turkey,

and contributes to the development of art awareness and art economy with activities such

as exhibitions, fairs and launches, aims to make Turkeyâs voice heard on international

platforms and with projects that will carry our countryâs artists to the international platform,

will continue on its way. We believe that our country, which is home to a deep-rooted

historical past and different ethnic and cultural values, will create a center of attraction in the

world with its artists and, by this means, contribute to the promotion of our country. What

we have to do is to show the necessary importance and sensitivity to art and artists, to

bring artists and art audiences together, and to build a bridge between the business world

and the art world. We are happy that every individual, institution and organization who is

interested and close to art at any level supports our association.

You can reach more detailed information about the works produced in our projects, the

exhibitions we take part in, and more detailed information about our association on the

website www.iyilikicinsanat.org and follow us on our social media account.
